title: Alejandra Teleguario Santizo
text:
Alejandra Teleguario Santizo (born around 2001 in <a href="Quetzaltenango">Quetzaltenango</a>, <a href="Guatemala">Guatemala</a>) is a <a href="Guatemala">Guatemala</a>n <a href="feminist">feminist</a> and activist for <a href="Women%27s%20rights">women's</a> and <a href="children%27s%20rights">children's rights</a> and <a href="sexual%20and%20reproductive%20rights">sexual and reproductive rights</a>.
Life.
Born around 2001 in <a href="Quetzaltenango">Quetzaltenango</a>, Alejandra Teleguario Santizo is the daughter of Oswaldo Teleguario and Lilian Santizo. In 2014, at 13 years of age, she was voted to become the mayor of the Council for Children and Adolescents of Quetzaltenango.
Teleguario Santizo has campaigned for <a href="women%27s%20rights">women's rights</a> in Guatemala since she was sixteen years old. Her activism has specifically focused on <a href="sexual%20violence">sexual violence</a> and <a href="street%20harassment">street harassment</a> in Guatemalan communities. She became a recurrent guest on radio programmes across the country, and joined a network of girl leaders, in a campaign against <a href="child%20marriage">child marriage</a>. She is a <a href="YouthLead">YouthLead</a> Ambassador, and pioneer within the Niñas Ayudando Niñas project ("girls supporting girls"). She founded the National, Departmental and Municipal Network Las Niñas Lideran (Girls Up), working for girls and <a href="teenage%20mother">teenage mother</a>s in the country. Due to her activism, she became a fellow of the <a href="Embassy%20of%20the%20United%20States%20in%20Guatemala">Embassy of the United States in Guatemala</a>. She was named a distinguished citizen of <a href="Quetzaltenango">Quetzaltenango</a>, and has presented her initiatives in the <a href="Congress%20of%20the%20Republic%20of%20Guatemala">Congress of the Republic of Guatemala</a>. In 2018, she met with <a href="Michelle%20Obama">Michelle Obama</a> to talk about women's rights and possibilities.
Teleguario Santizo has a teacher's diploma.
